title: How to Make Strawberry Orange Ricotta Cookies

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
steps.description: Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.

steps.headline: Whisk together the flour, baking powder and salt in a mixing bowl.
Combine the butter and sugar in a separate mixing bowl.
steps.description: Beat the butter and sugar for 3 minutes, using either a handheld mixer or a stand mixer with a paddle attachment that is set at medium speed.

steps.headline: Add the eggs, 1 at a time, and beat for 30 additional seconds.
Add the ricotta cheese, orange juice and orange zest and beat until just combined.
Turn the mixer down to low and slowly add the dry ingredients, about 1/2 cup at a time, mixing between each addition until the dry ingredients are just incorporated.
Drop the cookies onto the baking sheet, 1 tablespoon at a time.
steps.description: Leave about 1” (2-1/2 cm) around each cookie.

steps.headline: Bake the cookies for 12 to 15 minutes or until the cookies are lightly browned around the edges.
Remove the cookies from the oven and place them on the stovetop to cool for a few moments before you handle them.
Using a spatula, transfer the cookies from the baking sheet to a wire rack and allow the cookies to cool completely.
Combine the strawberry preserves, orange zest and vanilla in a bowl, stirring the mixture with a whisk.
Spread some glaze over each cooled cookie using either a cheese spreader or a butter knife.
Serve the cookies with a glass of cold milk or a hot cup of green tea.

text: Bake the Cookies Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper. Whisk together the flour, baking powder and salt in a mixing bowl.  Combine the butter and sugar in a separate mixing bowl. Beat the butter and sugar for 3 minutes, using either a handheld mixer or a stand mixer with a paddle attachment that is set at medium speed. Add the eggs, 1 at a time, and beat for 30 additional seconds.  Add the ricotta cheese, orange juice and orange zest and beat until just combined.  Turn the mixer down to low and slowly add the dry ingredients, about 1/2 cup at a time, mixing between each addition until the dry ingredients are just incorporated.  Drop the cookies onto the baking sheet, 1 tablespoon at a time. Leave about 1” (2-1/2 cm) around each cookie. Bake the cookies for 12 to 15 minutes or until the cookies are lightly browned around the edges.  Remove the cookies from the oven and place them on the stovetop to cool for a few moments before you handle them.  Using a spatula, transfer the cookies from the baking sheet to a wire rack and allow the cookies to cool completely.  Add the Glaze Combine the strawberry preserves, orange zest and vanilla in a bowl, stirring the mixture with a whisk.  Spread some glaze over each cooled cookie using either a cheese spreader or a butter knife.  Serve the cookies with a glass of cold milk or a hot cup of green tea.
